intro: Sebaea linearifolia, commonly known as the slender sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its linear, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color.
